unit: Unit 7 | Inference for Quantitative Data: Means
title: Point Estimator for a One Mean $t$-Interval: Fastball
question_text:
A $95\%$ confidence interval for the average fastball (mph) a professional athlete throws is $(96,101)$.
From this interval, what is the point estimate for his average fastball (in mph)?
solution:
A point estimator is a statistic that provides an estimate of the population parameter. In confidence intervals, point estimators represent the center of the confidence interval.

To find the point estimator, find the center (midpoint) of the confidence interval:

$$\text{Point Estimate} = \dfrac{ \text{Maximum Value + Minimum Value }}{ 2 } $$

$$=\dfrac { 101+96 }{ 2 } $$

$$= 98.5 \text{ mph}$$

Explanation of Distractors

Choice 'A' is incorrect as $2.5$ represents the margin of error.

Choice 'B' is incorrect as $5$ represents the range.

Choice 'C' is incorrect as $96$ represents the minimum value.

Choice 'E' is incorrect as $101$ represents the maximum value.
